meta.name: description
meta.content: All non-essential workers must continue to work from home and schools will be closed through May 15th.

meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: All non-essential workers must continue to work from home and schools will be closed through May 15th.
All non-essential workers must continue to work from home and schools will be closed through May 15th.

noscript.iframe: Your browser does not support iFrames

li.a: School of Public Health, Nursing or Administrators
Sell Products to New York State

p.strong: Call the Hotline: 1-888-364-3065 or Ask a Question

strong.a: We're Stronger If We All Work Together. Get Involved: How You Can Help

div.div: All non-essential workers must continue to work from home and schools will be closed through May 15th.

li.p: Schools and nonessential businesses will stay closed through May 15th.

span.span: Governor Cuomo issued executive orders 202.17 and 202.18 requiring all people in New York to wear masks or face coverings in public, including when taking public or private transportation or riding in for-hire vehicles.

li.p: Governor Cuomo announced a partnership with the federal government to double testing capacity in New York State.
The State Department of Health has begun to conduct statewide antibody testing. Find more information and FAQs.

span.span: Elective outpatient treatment can resume in counties and hospitals without significant risk of COVID-19 surge starting next week.
Governor Cuomo will meet President Trump at the White House on 4/21 to discuss testing.
Governor Cuomo announces the State will take a regional approach to re-opening.

li.p: New Yorkers without health insurance can apply through NY State of Health through May 15, 2020; must apply within 60 days of losing coverage.

span.span: New Yorkers can call the COVID-19 Emotional Support Hotline at 1-844-863-9314 for mental health counseling.
Testing is free for all eligible New Yorkers as ordered by a health care provider.
Your local health department is your community contact for COVID-19 concerns.

div.p: This guidance applies to each business location individually and is intended to assist businesses in determining whether they are an essential business and steps to request such designation.

h1.a: Get Involved: How You Can Help

div.p: Support New York's response. New York State is doing all it can to keep New Yorkers safe and stop the spread of COVID-19. But we’re stronger if we all work together.
Sign up for email updates from New York State with critical information on the Coronavirus pandemic.

div.div: Help Stop the Spread of the Novel Coronavirus

div.p: Even if you feel well, stay at home as much as possible. In public, keep at least 6 feet distance from others. Avoid unnecessary appointments.

div.div: Wash Your Hands. Cover Your Cough

div.p: Cover your cough and sneezes. Use your elbow or a tissue. Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.

div.div: Take Caution with New Yorkers At-Risk

div.p: Take special caution to avoid exposing the elderly and people with underlying health conditions. Avoid visiting those most at risk, call instead. Offer help with groceries and other goods.

span.div: protecting the public health of all New Yorkers

div.div: View a county-by-county breakdown of testing and positive cases around New York State.

div.a: Interim Guidance for Houses of Worship

div.p: For any local or state public or private facility to incorporate into their...

div.a: Interim Guidance for Public and Private Facilities

div.p: For any local or state public or private facility to incorporate into their...
Schools should continue to educate about proper hand and respiratory hygiene.

div.a: Interim Guidance for Food Manufacturing Facilities or Food...

div.p: For any food manufacturing facilities, food distribution centers or food retail...
Cleaning of areas occupied by an individual under movement restriction should...
Public transportation officials should ensure staff continue to perform routine...
For essential retail locations (grocery stores and pharmacies) so that owners,...

div.a: DEC List of Products to Disinfect COVID-19

div.p: Products registered in New York for use against COVID-19.
